Comments_List: I gained knowledge in Stoic doctrine and learned to navigate the history of Stoic thought. I refreshed my own reading knowledge of classical Greek. I was introduced to Epictetus and I read Marcus Aurelius with a new appreciation of the influences of Stoicism on his thought.
Facility in working with and interpreting difficult philosophical texts.

The ability for students to tailor the course requirements to their interests and past experience (choosing the Greek or English track) was a strength. 

The class could be improved by adding secondary readings to the assigned weekly readings or adding a third thinker (perhaps Sextus Empiricus?)
Yes. I would recommend this course to a student interested in philosophy, ancient history, modern thought reception, religion, or ethics.
